title: [Large-Scale] Instructional Design for Developing College Students' Thinking Skills Through Collaborative Practice

context.prior_knowledge: Basic learning skills and digital tool proficiency
context.additional_context: The process by which learners develop critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills through collaborative activities with peers within a Community of Practice (CoP)

learning_goals: Learners can analyze complex problems and apply critical thinking strategies through collaborative discussions across diverse academic contexts
Learners enhance creative problem-solving skills through digital content creation activities incorporating peer feedback

Learners develop a self-directed learning plan in a 2-week blended learning environment, including a weekly schedule with ≥3 sessions and SMART-based learning goals, participate ≥2 times weekly in an online community of practice (discussion board 1 session, study group 1 session), and submit activity logs (summary of participation and reflection ≥200 characters).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
